Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

8  KSTrajTermSynchrotron::KSTrajTermSynchrotron() :
9  fEnhancement( 1. ),
10  fOldMethode( false )

12  }
13  KSTrajTermSynchrotron::KSTrajTermSynchrotron( const KSTrajTermSynchrotron& aCopy ) :
14  KSComponent(),
15  fEnhancement( aCopy.fEnhancement ),
16  fOldMethode( aCopy.fOldMethode )

19  KSTrajTermSynchrotron* KSTrajTermSynchrotron::Clone() const
20  {

23  KSTrajTermSynchrotron::~KSTrajTermSynchrotron()

26 
27  void KSTrajTermSynchrotron::Differentiate(double /*aTime*/, const KSTrajExactParticle& aParticle, KSTrajExactDerivative& aDerivative ) const
28  {
29  double Q = aParticle.GetCharge();
30  double M = aParticle.GetMass();
31  double P = aParticle.GetMomentum().Magnitude();
32  double Gamma = aParticle.GetLorentzFactor();
33  double C = KConst::C();
34  if ( !fOldMethode )
35  {
36  //New Methode: Equations from abraham lorentz force
37  //the energy loss leads to an smaller polar angle, as mostly the orthogonal momentum is reduced.
38  KThreeVector tVelocity = aParticle.GetVelocity();
39  KThreeVector tLorentzForce = Q * (aParticle.GetElectricField() + tVelocity.Cross( aParticle.GetMagneticField() ));
40 
41  KThreeVector tAcceleration = tLorentzForce / (M * Gamma ) - 1.0 / ( M * M * C * C * Gamma * Gamma) * tVelocity * aParticle.GetMomentum().Dot( tLorentzForce );
42  double tTau = Q * Q / ( 6.0 * KConst::Pi() * KConst::EpsNull() * M * C * C * C);
43 
44  KThreeMatrix tElectricFieldGradient = aParticle.GetElectricGradient();
45  KThreeVector tMagneticField = aParticle.GetMagneticField();
46  KThreeMatrix tMagneticFieldGradient = aParticle.GetMagneticGradient();
47 
48  KThreeVector tFirstTerm = tVelocity * tElectricFieldGradient + tAcceleration.Cross( tMagneticField ) + tVelocity.Cross(tVelocity * tMagneticFieldGradient );
49 
50  KThreeVector tSecondTerm = Gamma * Gamma * Gamma / ( C * C) * ( tAcceleration.Cross( tVelocity.Cross( tLorentzForce ) ) );
51 
52  KThreeVector tForce = fEnhancement * tTau * ( Gamma * Q * tFirstTerm - tSecondTerm );
53 
54  aDerivative.AddToForce( tForce );
55 
56  }
57  else
58  {
59  //Old Methode: Equations from Dans derivations
60  //correct energy loss, but the total energy is reduced, not the orthogonal component
61  double Factor = (KConst::MuNull() / (6. * KConst::Pi() * KConst::C())) * ((Q * Q * Q * Q) / (M * P * P));
62 
63  KThreeVector tTUnit = aParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
64  KThreeVector tUUnit = aParticle.GetMomentum().Cross( aParticle.GetMagneticField() ).Unit();
65  KThreeVector tVUnit = tTUnit.Cross( tUUnit ).Unit();
66 
67  double tET = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tTUnit );
68  double tEU = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tUUnit );
69  double tEV = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tVUnit );
70  double tBV = aParticle.GetMagneticField().Dot( tVUnit );
71  double tXi1 = tET * tET + tBV * tBV * (P / M) * (P / M);
72  double tXi2 = -2. * tEU * tBV * (P / M);
73  double tXi3 = tEU * tEU + tEV * tEV;
74 
75  KThreeVector tForce = -fEnhancement * Factor * (Gamma * tXi1 + Gamma * Gamma * tXi2 + Gamma * Gamma * Gamma * tXi3) * aParticle.GetMomentum();
76 
77  aDerivative.AddToForce( tForce );
78  }
79 
80 
81  return;
82  }
83  void KSTrajTermSynchrotron::Differentiate(double /*aTime*/, const KSTrajAdiabaticParticle& aParticle, KSTrajAdiabaticDerivative& aDerivative ) const
84  {
85  double Q = aParticle.GetCharge();
86  double M = aParticle.GetMass();
87  double Factor = (KConst::MuNull() / (6. * KConst::Pi() * KConst::C())) * ((Q * Q * Q * Q) / (M * M * M));
88 
89  double tForce = -fEnhancement * Factor * aParticle.GetLorentzFactor() * aParticle.GetMagneticField().MagnitudeSquared() * aParticle.GetTransMomentum();
90 
91  aDerivative.AddToTransverseForce( tForce );
92 
93  return;
94  }
95  void KSTrajTermSynchrotron::Differentiate(double aTime, const KSTrajExactTrappedParticle& aParticle, KSTrajExactTrappedDerivative& aDerivative) const
96  {
97  if(aTime==0) return;
98 
99  double Q = aParticle.GetCharge();
100  double M = aParticle.GetMass();
101  double P = aParticle.GetMomentum().Magnitude();
102  double Gamma = aParticle.GetLorentzFactor();
103  double C = KConst::C();
104  if ( !fOldMethode )
105  {
106  //New Methode: Equations from abraham lorentz force
107  //the energy loss leads to an smaller polar angle, as mostly the orthogonal momentum is reduced.
108  KThreeVector tVelocity = aParticle.GetVelocity();
109  KThreeVector tLorentzForce = Q * (aParticle.GetElectricField() + tVelocity.Cross( aParticle.GetMagneticField() ));
110 
111  KThreeVector tAcceleration = tLorentzForce / (M * Gamma ) - 1.0 / ( M * M * C * C * Gamma * Gamma) * tVelocity * aParticle.GetMomentum().Dot( tLorentzForce );
112  double tTau = Q * Q / ( 6.0 * KConst::Pi() * KConst::EpsNull() * M * C * C * C);
113 
114  KThreeMatrix tElectricFieldGradient = aParticle.GetElectricGradient();
115  KThreeVector tMagneticField = aParticle.GetMagneticField();
116  KThreeMatrix tMagneticFieldGradient = aParticle.GetMagneticGradient();
117 
118  KThreeVector tFirstTerm = tVelocity * tElectricFieldGradient + tAcceleration.Cross( tMagneticField ) + tVelocity.Cross(tVelocity * tMagneticFieldGradient );
119 
120  KThreeVector tSecondTerm = Gamma * Gamma * Gamma / ( C * C) * ( tAcceleration.Cross( tVelocity.Cross( tLorentzForce ) ) );
121 
122  KThreeVector tForce = fEnhancement * tTau * ( Gamma * Q * tFirstTerm - tSecondTerm );
123 
124  aDerivative.AddToForce( tForce );
125 
126  }
127  else
128  {
129  //Old Methode: Equations from Dans derivations
130  //correct energy loss, but the total energy is reduced, not the orthogonal component
131  double Factor = (KConst::MuNull() / (6. * KConst::Pi() * KConst::C())) * ((Q * Q * Q * Q) / (M * P * P));
132 
133  KThreeVector tTUnit = aParticle.GetMomentum().Unit();
134  KThreeVector tUUnit = aParticle.GetMomentum().Cross( aParticle.GetMagneticField() ).Unit();
135  KThreeVector tVUnit = tTUnit.Cross( tUUnit ).Unit();
136 
137  double tET = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tTUnit );
138  double tEU = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tUUnit );
139  double tEV = aParticle.GetElectricField().Dot( tVUnit );
140  double tBV = aParticle.GetMagneticField().Dot( tVUnit );
141  double tXi1 = tET * tET + tBV * tBV * (P / M) * (P / M);
142  double tXi2 = -2. * tEU * tBV * (P / M);
143  double tXi3 = tEU * tEU + tEV * tEV;
144 
145  KThreeVector tForce = -fEnhancement * Factor * (Gamma * tXi1 + Gamma * Gamma * tXi2 + Gamma * Gamma * Gamma * tXi3) * aParticle.GetMomentum();
146 
147  aDerivative.AddToForce( tForce );
148  }
149 
150 
151  return;
152  }
